meanings.definition: Instill (an attitude, idea, or habit) by persistent instruction.
meanings.sent1: She inculcated the importance of kindness in her children through daily reminders.
meanings.sent2: The teacher inculcated the value of hard work in her students.
meanings.sent3: The parrot inculcated the phrase 'Polly wants a cracker' after hearing it repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: The melody inculcated in my mind, playing on a loop throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The coach inculcated the winning strategy into the team, ensuring they were well-prepared.

meanings.definition: Teach (someone) an attitude, idea, or habit by persistent instruction.
meanings.sent1: He inculcated his apprentice in the art of woodworking, passing down his skills.
meanings.sent2: The elders inculcated traditional values in the younger generation.
meanings.sent3: The robot inculcated the dance moves after being programmed with the routine.
meanings.sent4: The story inculcated a sense of adventure in the young readers.
meanings.sent5: The mentor inculcated a sense of responsibility in his mentee, guiding them towards success.
